---
title: "Split pea soup"
date: "2025-01-25"
categories: [soup, easy, instantpot]
---

Warm and comforting. Cooks in 30 minutes or so, mostly unattended.


---


- 1 lb split peas
- 1 large onion, diced
- 3 celery stalks, diced
- 2&ndash;3 carrots, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 bay leaves
- olive oil or butter
- 1 tsp dried thyme
- 6oz ham steak, cubed
- parmesean cheese
- salt and pepper
- 2L stock or water

---

1. Set InstantPot to Saute. Dice onion. Add oil to pot with onion. Saute about 
5 minutes with a pinch of salt.
1. Meanwhile dice celery and carrots. Add to pot.
1. Finely chop garlic. Add to pot and saute another minute. Turn off pot.
1. Add split peas, ham, thyme, bay leaves and water or stock. Season lightly 
with salt. 
1. Seal cooker and cook on high pressure for 20 minutes. 
1. Rapidly release pressure so that the split peas puree. Adjust for seasoning
and consistency, adding more water or stock as necessary.
